Bank Teller Job at Catilas Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Catilas Resources Limited - Our client, a Commercial Bank, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Bank Teller

Job Location: Nationwide
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	‎We are recruiting for our client a Commercial Bank, seeks friendly and enthusiastic Bank Tellers to deliver exceptional customer service.
	As the first point of contact, you'll answer customer inquiries, handle transactions, and resolve customer issues.
	Your goal is to make every customer feel valued and supported.


‎Responsibilities
     

            
    




	‎Provide excellent customer service and share information about banking products
	‎Handle cash transactions with accuracy and efficiency
	‎Resolve customer issues and promote additional services
	‎Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless service


‎‎Requirements


	‎OND Holder in any field with a minimum of Lower Credit
	‎Experience in banking is a plus.
	‎25 years old or younger
	‎Strong communication skills and a friendly attitude
	‎Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, and Outlook)


Salary
N114,000 Monthly.

Accountant / Admin Officer Job at StaffbridgeHR Limited




        
    

        
        StaffbridgeHR Limited is a start up HR outsourcing company,specializingin not only end to end rceruitment and staff management , but also serves as recruiter for organizations. We take the responsibility of managing sales and factory staff off organisations, allowing them to concentrate on coreareas of their businesses. We keep up with employment regulations, Tax laws and best practices, reducing legal risks.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Admin Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant/Admin Officer to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will manage day-to-day accounting operations, ensure accurate financial records, and provide administrative support to ensure smooth office operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and maintain financial records, invoices, receipts, and payment vouchers.
	Reconcile bank statements and manage petty cash.
	Assist in preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and company policies.
	Provide administrative support including correspondence, filing, and office management.
	Coordinate with vendors, clients, and staff on finance and admin matters.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 2–3 years of relevant experience.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and MS Excel/Accounting software.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.
	Attention to detail and strong analytical ability.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Remuneration
Competitive and commensurate with experience.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: hr@staffbridgehr.com using "Application – Accountant / Admin Officer" as the subject of the mail.

	Reconciliation of payments and receipts
	Confirmation of customer deposits and Issuance of receipts
	Manage all accounting transaction.
	Administering payrolls and controlling income and expenditure
	Auditing financial information
	Compiling and presenting reports, budgets, business plans, commentaries and financial statements.
	Any other related tasks as may be assigned.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	4+ years of post of experience in a relevant accounting role.
	Experience with accounting software is an added advantage.
	Must be analytical, and pay attention to details.
	Knowledge and competency in accounting principles.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@choicetalents.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at HR-Aid Consults
content:
HR-Aid Consults - Our clients in various sectors are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Accountant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Chief Operating Officer / Managing Director

Key Responsibilities
Financial Planning, Control & Reporting:
     

            
    




	Oversee day-to-day financial operations, budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow management.
	Lead the preparation and timely submission of financial statements, including:
	Management accounts (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)
	CBN/Regulatory returns
	Monthly, quarterly, and annual reports for internal and external stakeholders
	Develop, monitor, and analyze budgets and financial performance. Conduct variance analyses and provide actionable insights.
	Prepare accurate cash flow forecasts to support liquidity and funding needs.
	Manage tax planning, computation, remittance, and statutory deductions (PAYE, VAT, WHT, etc.).


Compliance & Internal Controls:


	Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations including CBN guidelines, FIRS requirements, and IFRS standards.
	Establish and maintain robust internal control systems, policies, and procedures.
	Liaise with external auditors, regulators, and tax consultants.
	Ensure proper record-keeping, audit readiness, and risk mitigation.


Portfolio & Credit Oversight (Supporting COO):


	Collaborate with the credit and risk teams to ensure quality loan underwriting, sound credit decisioning, and portfolio monitoring.
	Monitor credit performance and analyze delinquencies; support recovery efforts and portfolio remedial actions.
	Conduct periodic loan book and collateral reviews to ensure compliance with facility agreements.
	Support the COO in credit risk evaluation and monthly risk asset meetings.


Strategic Financial Advisory:


	Provide insights and recommendations to support the company’s financial strategy, investment decisions, and operational improvements.
	Drive automation and digital transformation in the finance department.
	Track key financial metrics and performance indicators to support business goals.
	Assist in capital raising, investor relations, and business expansion strategies when required.


Key Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration (required)
	Minimum of 7–10 years of progressive experience in financial management, preferably in a financial services or lending institution
	Qualified Accountant (ICAN/ACCA) – required
	Demonstrated experience in financial reporting, budgeting, tax, audit coordination, and regulatory reporting
	Strong understanding of credit risk, loan operations, and treasury management
	Hands-on experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books) and advanced Excel skills
	Familiarity with Nigerian tax laws and CBN regulatory guidelines


Skills and Competencies:
Core Competencies:


	In-depth knowledge of financial accounting, controls, and performance management
	Ability to interpret financial data and draw strategic conclusions
	Ability to build, lead and motivate a finance team with integrity and accountability
	Knowledge of credit risk, financial risks, and regulatory risks
	Proficiency in accounting systems, automation tools, and reporting dashboards
	Ability to align financial management with overall business objectives


Soft Skills:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively under pressure
	Attention to detail and high levels of accuracy
	Results-oriented and proactive approach
	Critical thinker and problem-solver
	Client-focused mindset and commercial awareness.


Salary
N500,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 3rd October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talent@hr-aidconsults.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Account Officer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Senior Accountant

Job Summary


	The Account Officer oversees inventory management, ensuring accurate tracking, timely ordering, and efficient reconciliation.
	This role conducts cycle counts, monitors stock levels, manages vendor relationships, reconciles inventory, and calculates inventory values.
	This role also analyzes inventory data, reduces inventory costs, and ensures compliance with the company’s standards.


Responsibilities


	Regularly generate and review pending purchase bills to ensure timely processing and order fulfillment.
	Export the purchase bill pending from Tally, sorting by product, location, and quality in Excel for clarity and reporting.
	Take note of re-order levels during sorting to proactively manage inventory and avoid stock outs.
	Monitor the status of complete, delivered, and shipping orders, ensuring that timely updates are communicated.
	Review all locations for pending stock lifts and ensure that all sales are posted accurately.
	Send instructions to the bank for the payment of goods, ensuring timely financial transactions.
	Accurately post all generated orders in Click-it and Tally to maintain updated inventory records.
	Reconcile Lafarge payments against purchases as recorded in the company ensuring financial accuracy.
	Conduct the same reconciliation processes for BUA and Dangote, maintaining consistent financial tracking.
	Check the status of all logons before the end of the day, ensuring completed logons are posted accurately.
	Prepare and present regular inventory reports to management, highlighting stock levels, pending orders, and any discrepancies.
	Develop and implement inventory control procedures to enhance efficiency and accuracy in stock management.
	Perform any other duties as directed by the Senior Accountant and the MD.


Academic Qualifications / Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	3 to 5 years of experience in inventory management.
	Understanding of Inventory Control processes and procedures.
	Proficiency in Tally, Click-it, Excel, and other accounting software.
	Strong data analysis skills for inventory tracking and reporting.
	Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong communication skills for effective collaboration with suppliers, banks, and internal teams.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 3rd October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talent@hr-aidconsults.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Retail Store Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The Retail Store Manager will ensure the smooth operation of the company in specific geographic locations. The Retail Store Manager will oversee the productivity and performance of the company's employees in a specific region.
	The Retail Store Manager may manage a specific location or work across several states or union territories.


Key Responsibilities


	Preparing and presenting regional reports for senior management
	Mentoring employees and suggesting training programs
	Overseeing the recruitment of employees in the region
	Negotiating contracts with suppliers, vendors, and manufacturers
	Developing business, marketing and advertising plans
	Planning and evaluating operations to be cost-effective
	Preparing quarterly and yearly reports, analyses, statements and reports on finance and operations
	Enforcing the company’s rules and regulations
	Seeking new business opportunities in the region and securing contracts for the company
	Developing project plans and assigning regional project personnel
	Securing long-term relationships by maintaining practical client relations.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Sales or Marketing with 5 years experience
	Relevant experience in sales, retail & the food service industry
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, and creative environment


Skills:


	Strong leadership skills
	Strong organizational, planning & budgeting skills
	Great understanding of business
	Attention to detail
	Strategic planning
	Ability to meet targets.


Salary
N300,000 - N350,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 17th October, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ada@hr-aidconsults.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

     

    

        Click here to Apply
